Text:
Soft moonlight illuminates the austere cathedral,
painting it a dreamy hue.

A beautiful, gold-haired elf approaches the cathedral
alone. Her blue eyes turn to the statue of Olivier.
We wish to know the truth...
Brave Olivier, what did you do within the Sanctuary?

Each time we pull back a layer of our dark history,
we find more truths and lies interwoven together.
Archbishop Drake, what were you hiding?

If only you could talk. I really would have liked an
answer.

Who was it that killed you? Who was it who could
easily dispose of a man with your status?

Dark whispers about the archbishop had reached the
royal capital, meaning an investigation would likely
have been launched soon. He was eliminated before
that could happen.
We await the opening of these doors tomorrow.
Your Holiness! Archbishop!!!
*shocked gasp*
What blasphemy is this?!
Seal the building! Do not let the culprit escape!

The paladins who find the archbishop's body never
speak of the blonde elf to anyone. None of them
are even aware of her presence.

(The festivities on the eve of the Goddess' Trial
are off to a roaring start.)

(The main street is littered with stalls, and the lamps
practically form a river of light.)

(Rose is apparently at a party for the Church.
I wasn't invited, of course, but I would have
declined even if I were.)
Bells ring, heralding the arrival of chaos.
I look down upon it all from on high.
Yes, this will do just fine.

(I love this pattern of looking out over the city and
people from high places.)

(All the better since it's night and there's some
event unfolding right before my eyes.)
Hm?
(Maybe it's a thief.)
So it's begun...

I will forgive you for your choice. But that will not
change your fate.

Sensing something is wrong, the man hides himself in a
back alley.
Did you think you could escape...?

At night, the world dims, transforming it into our
domain...
And none can escape it.
Gwaaaagh!!!

You fired off magic infused into your slash, I see...
I would expect no less from Epsilon the Faithful.
I'm honored.
It's been some time, my lord.

(The one kneeling before me is Epsilonâ€”the fifth of
the Seven Shadows.)

(She's an elf with hair the color of a clear lake and
her eyes are just a slightly deeper shade.)

(There are various forms of beauty, and hers is of
the flashy sort. Her facial features are clear and
distinct, and so is her figure.)

(And those jugs of hers jiggling with every move she
makes will catch anyone's eye whether you're into
that sort of thing or not.)

(Her ringing voice may come off as imperious to some, 
but I don't mind it since it reminds me of a piano.)
(Her nickname is Epsilon the Faithful.)

(She boasts the most precise magic control of all
the Seven Shadows. Magic is normally difficult to
manipulate once it leaves the body.)

(But Epsilon is able to do so without breaking a
sweat and excels at slashing from a distance.)

(She also listens to Alpha and is the type who
strictly adheres to the pecking order.)

(Alright. If that's how she wants to do it, I can
respond in kind.)
So Alpha's letter... Um, I mean...
How is the plan proceeding?

(Did I just bungle that? We're in Shadow Garden mode
now, though, so I bet she'll play along.)

The target was slain by the Executioner of the Cult. 
We dealt with the henchmen, but the Executioner
has managed to elude us.
I see...
(An Executioner, eh? I like the sound of that.)
We're shifting to our second plan.
(The old "if plan A fails, go with plan B" option.)

Very well. But you do know what will come of this,
I trust?

We're prepared. Prepared to make enemies of the
Church and to be named evildoers...
I'll act on my own. Don't fail me...
Yes, sir.

(Epsilon is prideful and headstrong, but when it
comes to me, she's much softer.)

(People tend to misunderstand her, but she's a good
girl who used to make me tea every day.)
(And I know her secret.)

(The amount of slime Epsilon has padded on tells me
all I need to know about how fierce her pride is.)
